definition: to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
to open (a door)/to open up (for development)/to dispel/to refute/to repudiate

sentences.english: The budget the Democrats passed this week charts a new course.
sentences.chinese: 民主黨這個星期通過的預算將另闢蹊徑。

sentences.english: For a final project, we wanted to take a different tact.
sentences.chinese: 由於是最後一個項目，我們想另闢蹊徑。

sentences.english: Deliberately push yourself out of your routine. Try things that you do not normally try.
sentences.chinese: 要刻意去另闢蹊徑，嘗試那些你平時沒試過的東西。

sentences.english: People will move sideways to do different jobs.
sentences.chinese: 人們能夠另闢蹊徑，接觸到各種不同的工作。

definition: see 承前啟後|承前启后[cheng2 qian2 qi3 hou4]
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to make painstaking efforts (idiom); after much trouble/to work hard at sth
freehand drawing or painting in traditional Chinese style
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
